title: Prince William and wife Kate land in Pakistan capital after aborted flight
text:
Britain's Prince William and Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge, depart from Lahore airport, Pakistan October 18, 2019. REUTERS/Peter Nicholls/Pool

ISLAMABAD (Reuters) - Britain’s Prince William and his wife Kate landed in Pakistan’s capital Islamabad on Friday, after turbulence forced the couple to stay overnight in Lahore.

On Thursday an RAF Voyager carrying the royals, who are on a four-day official visit to Pakistan, aborted landings in Islamabad and nearby Rawalpindi due to severe turbulence.
description: Britain's Prince William and his wife Kate landed in Pakistan's capital Islamabad on Friday, after turbulence forced the couple to stay overnight in Lahore.
